intro: Achania pilosa, commonly known as the hairy achania, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Achania pilosa is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
